message.content:
<<>>: File.createNewFile <<>>: // In your action class String scanData = request.getParameter("scanData"); File file = new File("path/to/your/file.txt"); if(!file.exists()){ file.createNewFile(); } FileWriter fw = new FileWriter(file.getAbsoluteFile(), true); BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(fw); bw.write(scanData); bw.close(); // In your JSP <% String itemname = (String)session.getAttribute("itemname"); %> <% String lotnumber = (String)session.getAttribute("lotnumber"); %> <% String godownname = (String)session.getAttribute("godownname"); %>
<% String message = (String)session.getAttribute("message"); session.setAttribute( "theFileName", message ); %> Filename : <%= message %>
Item Name :<%= itemname %>
Lot Number :<%= lotnumber %>
Godown Name :<%= godownname %>

<<>>: In your action class, you can get the value of the "scanData" parameter from the request, create a new file if it doesn't exist, and write the scan data to the file. In your JSP, you can use the Struts form tag to create a form that submits the scan data to your action class. After the data is written to the file, the page will be reloaded with the scanData text box cleared.
